subs.text: @shanselman aka Superman  is undeniably a remarkable speaker. He is able to take the most mundane thing, like migrating his blog to the cloud, and spin it into a 55 minute journey during which you get a full semester of computer science training and didn't even know it.
subs.rawText: @shanselman aka Superman  is undeniably a remarkable speaker. He is able to take the most mundane thing, like migrating his blog to the cloud, and spin it into a 55 minute journey during which you get a full semester of computer science training and didn't even know it.

subs.text: But he is teaching so much more than what he is talking about. Observe his intimate knowledge of his chosen OS and how he uses it's features to be productive. Ignore what he is saying and just watch him use the computer. That alone is worth your time.
subs.rawText: But he is teaching so much more than what he is talking about. Observe his intimate knowledge of his chosen OS and how he uses it's features to be productive. Ignore what he is saying and just watch him use the computer. That alone is worth your time.

subs.text: On another level, he gives you a lesson in how to be a good human being. His talks are remarkable and every one is pure gold. [link]
subs.rawText: On another level, he gives you a lesson in how to be a good human being. His talks are remarkable and every one is pure gold.  https://t.co/NjF4YlM4Mt

subs.text: It's 2022 and I am still forced to print documents to feed bureaucracy. The future is still not here. I keep waiting. [link]
subs.rawText: It's 2022 and I am still forced to print documents to feed bureaucracy. The future is still not here. I keep waiting. https://t.co/5LigLOiV3y

subs.text: Too bad Windows Phone failed. I still believe it had the best user experience and such a fresh design. [link]
subs.rawText: Too bad Windows Phone failed.  I still believe it had the best user experience and such a fresh design. https://t.co/OfIwv3ltyY

subs.text: @wincent I often try to migrate to Apple Numbers, which is a really nice application when you understand it, but the features of Google Sheets just keep me going back. The ability to work on it from any platform and share it with anyone is too compelling.
subs.rawText: @wincent I often try to migrate to Apple Numbers, which is a really nice application when you understand it, but the features of Google Sheets just keep me going back. The ability to work on it from any platform and share it with anyone is too compelling.
